summary: FBI 302 report documenting an interview with inmate FREDERICO RANCIER, who was housed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in July 2019. RANCIER provides a detailed eyewitness account of the events surrounding an apparent suicide attempt by his fellow inmate, widely understood to be Jeffrey Epstein, including alleged negligence and misconduct by correctional officers.

persons.name: Frederico Rancier
persons.context: Inmate housed in the SHU at MCC from July 16-26, 2019; provides a detailed account of the incident involving his fellow inmate's suicide attempt and the officers' response.

persons.name: Hacinta Garcia
persons.context: Rancier's cellmate for the entire time he was in the SHU at MCC.

persons.name: Officer G
persons.context: Correctional officer referred to as 'G' who worked the morning shift at MCC; Rancier recalls his face but not necessarily his name.

persons.name: Officer Noel
persons.context: Correctional officer whose picture was shown to Rancier; he stated she looked familiar but was not present the night of the incident.

persons.name: Officer Thomas
persons.context: Correctional officer whose picture was shown to Rancier; he stated Thomas worked in the SHU but was not there the night of the incident.

connections.description: Were cellmates in the SHU at MCC for the period July 16-26, 2019.
Rancier observed Officer G working the morning shift and recalled his face.

events.title: Inmate Suicide Attempt at MCC SHU
events.description: An inmate (understood to be Jeffrey Epstein) attempted to hang himself from his bed ladder around 1:20-1:30am. His cellmate screamed for help. Officers responded after a delay, did not administer CPR, and handled the inmate roughly. The incident led to changes in SHU procedures.

events.title: FBI Interview of Frederico Rancier
events.description: FBI agents and Assistant U.S. Attorneys interviewed inmate Frederico Rancier about his observations of the suicide attempt incident at MCC.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, New York
United States Attorney's Office (USAO), Southern District of New York, New York, New York
keyFacts: Witness Frederico Rancier provides a first-hand account of the suicide attempt by an inmate (Epstein) in the MCC SHU, stating it occurred around 1:20-1:30am on a night when no midnight inmate check had been conducted.
Rancier alleges correctional officers did not administer CPR to the inmate, who appeared dead with a blue skin tone, and handled him roughly, dropping him hard onto a stretcher.
Rancier states a Lieutenant present had a video camera but initially pointed it at her leg, not at the cell, and only turned it toward the cell after the cell had been cleaned.
Rancier reports that after the incident, procedures in the SHU changed: officers started bringing books to inmates, inmates had easier phone access, and regular inmate checks (12am, 3am, 5am) began.
The document is an official FBI 302 report, indicating the FBI was investigating the circumstances surrounding Epstein's death/attempt in August 2019.
